story:
In 1952, a mere 13 years after Little League Baseball was formed, a group of private citizens affiliated with Indiana Central College (now known as University of Indianapolis) donated the land that Indiana Central Little League now rests on. Indiana Central Little League (ICLL) is proud to be the oldest operating little league park in the State of Indiana. The year 2015 marked out 63st year of providing a safe and beautiful place for boys and girls of all ages to play America's favorite pastime.

ICLL started very modestly, but over the years has grown into a ballpark with seven beautiful diamonds that are maintained immaculately strictly by a dedicated group of volunteers. There are three fields with lights, including one of the best softball fields in Indiana, which, in recent years, was proud to host the Lady Greyhounds from the University of Indianapolis as their home field. We also have a full service concession stand staffed only by all volunteers.

ICLL has been very successful over the years, winning many district titles in softball and baseball, as well as several State Champion teams. We are proud to be a part of Little League International, and proud to serve the families of our community.

Because ICLL is a private non-profit organization, our funding is raised through sponsors, fundraisers and our concession stand sales.  The operating budget is just over $50,000 per year for the park and due to the cost of operating the facility, funds are always tight.  When major expenses occur unexpectedly, our only option is to pass the hat.  We are grateful to all of our sponsors and the volunteers who have kept our parks open for over 60 years. 


Last year, our 1985 John Deere 750 Tractor had an oil leak resulting in a thrown rod and bent crank shaft.  We were unable to obtain funds over the winter and have spent the spring doing the heavy lifting around our park by hand or with personal vehicles. 

We discovered Indiegogo a few months ago and was encouraged by the generosity of donors around the world who care about children, health and sports with the same passion as our Board Members, sponsors and volunteers.  We found a small shop in southern Indiana to give us a detailed estimate of the repairs.  We are going to have the repairs completed so that we can continue to maintain our fields.  As a non-profit organization, our goal is to raise the entire amount for the repair however; whatever you can give will go towards the repairs.

Estimate for JD 750:

Crankshaft – reground  $600

Connecting rod $100

Ring, bearings, gaskets, valve job $400

25 hours labor $1250

Total $2350

Once this tractor is repaired, the volunteers who help keep our grounds looking good will be able to let the backs start to heal. 

Thank you to all of those who consider giving to our campaign.  In honor of those who do commit $25 or more towards the repairs, ICLL will create a plaque to be displayed along side a picture of the repaired tractor with your name or organization name inscribed in a plate to memorialize your generosity.  This plaque will be mounted and displayed permanently in the concession area for all to see.  If your generosity exceeds our expectations, the extra funds will go towards new equipment for our teams and general expenditures. 

All donations are tax deductible.

What you will receive: 

Little League Donor:  $1-$25

You will have the satisfaction of knowing you are helping keep baseball alive in Central Indiana.

Major League Donor:  $25-$100

You will have the satisfaction of knowing you are helping keep baseball alive in Central Indiana AND your name or organizations name laser engraved on a custom "Major League" Donor Plaque to be displayed permanently in the concession area for all to see along side a picture of the repaired tractor.


Hall of Fame Donor: $101-$500

You will have the satisfaction of knowing you are helping keep baseball alive in Central Indiana AND your name or organizations name laser engraved on a custom "Hall of Fame" Donor Plaque to be displayed permanently in the concession area for all to see along side a picture of the repaired tractor.  We will announce all Hall of Fame Donor's at the opening day Ceremony for the 2016 season.


Legend:  $35,000


As a legend, you will become an icon at Indiana Central.  With $35,000 we will purchase a 2013 John Deere 4520 from our local John Deere dealer and have it repainted with Indiana Central's colors and your name or your organization's name artfully air brushed on the side.  Your name or organizations name will be memorialized in a plaque with a picture of the painted tractor flanked by entire  2016 little league players gathered around.  The tractor will lead the 2016 opening day parade and a special presentation will be conducted on your behalf.  If you are local or are willing to travel to our fields; we will include you in the opening day ceremony. 



Other Ways You Can Help:

Sponsor a Child:  $76.00

(This exact amount lets us know your intentions)

If tractor repairs do not interest you, we would like to provide the opportunity for you to donate to sponsor a boy or girl to play baseball or softball in 2016.  There are many parents with children in Central Indiana who could use a helping hand.  Your donation will be discreetly distributed to families the Board of Directors identifies as good candidates.

Sponsor a Family:  $130.00

(This exact amount lets us know your intentions)

If tractor repairs do not interest you, we would like to provide the opportunity for you to donate to sponsor a family with two children to play baseball or softball in 2016.  There are many parents with children in Central Indiana who could use a helping hand.  Your donation will be discreetly distributed to families the Board of Directors identifies as good candidates.


Indiana Central Little League
4410 S Keystone Ave, Indianapolis, IN 46227
(317) 783-1066
story_txt:
In 1952, a mere 13 years after
Little League Baseball was formed, a group of private citizens affiliated with
Indiana Central College (now known as University of Indianapolis) donated the
land that Indiana Central Little League now rests on. Indiana Central Little
League (ICLL) is proud to be the oldest operating little league park in the
State of Indiana. The year 2015 marked out 63st year of providing a safe and
beautiful place for boys and girls of all ages to play America's favorite
pastime. 
ICLL started very modestly, but over
the years has grown into a ballpark with seven beautiful diamonds that are
maintained immaculately strictly by a dedicated group of volunteers. There are
three fields with lights, including one of the best softball fields in Indiana,
which, in recent years, was proud to host the Lady Greyhounds from the
University of Indianapolis as their home field. We also have a full service
concession stand staffed only by all volunteers.
ICLL has been very successful over
the years, winning many district titles in softball and baseball, as well as
several State Champion teams. We are proud to be a part of Little League
International, and proud to serve the families of our community.
Because ICLL is a private non-profit
organization, our funding is raised through sponsors, fundraisers and our
concession stand sales.  The operating budget is just over $50,000 per
year for the park and due to the cost of operating the facility, funds are
always tight.  When major expenses occur unexpectedly, our only option is
to pass the hat.  We are grateful to all of our sponsors and the
volunteers who have kept our parks open for over 60 years.  
Last year, our 1985 John Deere 750
Tractor had an oil leak resulting in a thrown rod and bent crank shaft. 
We were unable to obtain funds over the winter and have spent the spring doing
the heavy lifting around our park by hand or with personal vehicles.  
We discovered Indiegogo a few months
ago and was encouraged by the generosity of donors around the world who care
about children, health and sports with the same passion as our Board Members, sponsors and volunteers.  We found a small shop in southern Indiana to
give us a detailed estimate of the repairs.  We
are going to have the repairs completed so that we can continue to maintain our
fields.  As a non-profit organization, our goal is to raise the entire amount for the repair
however; whatever you can give will go towards the repairs.

Estimate for JD 750:
Crankshaft – reground  $600 
Connecting rod $100
Ring, bearings, gaskets, valve job
$400
25 hours labor $1250
Total $2350

Once this tractor is repaired, the
volunteers who help keep our grounds looking good will be able to let the backs
start to heal.  
Thank you to all of those who consider
giving to our campaign.  In honor of those who do commit $25 or more
towards the repairs, ICLL will create a plaque to be displayed along side a picture of the repaired tractor with your name or organization name inscribed in a plate to memorialize your
generosity.  This plaque will be mounted and displayed permanently in the
concession area for all to see.  If your generosity exceeds our
expectations, the extra funds will go towards new equipment for our teams and
general expenditures.  All donations are tax deductible.
What you will receive:  
Little League Donor:  $1-$25
You will have the satisfaction of
knowing you are helping keep baseball alive in Central Indiana.
Major League Donor:  $25-$100
You will have the satisfaction of
knowing you are helping keep baseball alive in Central Indiana AND your name or
organizations name laser engraved on a custom "Major League" Donor
Plaque to be displayed permanently in the concession area for all to see along side a picture of the repaired tractor.
Hall of Fame Donor: $101-$500
You will have the satisfaction of
knowing you are helping keep baseball alive in Central Indiana AND your name or
organizations name laser engraved on a custom "Hall of Fame" Donor
Plaque to be displayed permanently in the concession area for all to see along side a picture of the repaired tractor.  We will announce all Hall of Fame
Donor's at the opening day Ceremony for the 2016 season.
Legend:  $35,000

at Indiana Central.  With $35,000 we will purchase a 2013 John Deere 4520
from our local John Deere dealer and have it repainted with Indiana Central's
colors and your name or your organization's name artfully air brushed on the
side.  Your name or organizations name will be memorialized in a plaque
with a picture of the painted tractor flanked by entire  2016 little
league players gathered around.  The tractor will lead the 2016 opening
day parade and a special presentation will be conducted on your behalf. 
If you are local or are willing to travel to our fields; we will include you in
the opening day ceremony.

story:
TIME Magazine Article on BILLY cigarettes                

                     



        


     






 




Created as the GREEN option in smoking, BILLYs is the only cigarette that gives you an option to keep smoking but greener, or smoke it as a catalyst to quit nicotine addiction. 

 1.  Smoke greener 

 2.  Smoke as a catalyst to downgrade nicotine addiction

The most economical cigarette, the BILLYs cost $4 less than the national average of tobacco cigarettes and significantly less than electronic vaping.  In the most populated states like NY, CA, FL, WA, MA, TX, IL - the average savings is at around $9 a pack. That is a $90 in savings per a carton, for a green cigarette made only with green tea as the raw material.  

Compare cigarette prices and confirm that BILLYs will be saving smokers thousands, and hopefully help stop future cancer diagnosis of so many.  

We are committed to keep the retail price at $25 per a carton.

                 

                                REGULAR                                                   MENTHOL

                                                                        



You can actually smoke the BILLY, and at the same time reduce tar, many carcinogenic byproducts, eliminate tobacco, eliminate nicotine, and use this product as a catalyst to stop being hurt by traditional cigarettes.  We even created a process to help guide you.  The BILLY process isn't easy and it takes about 90 days, but after the first 30 days it gets better and your brain will start to adapt, so if you want to know the process or familiarize it to help your friends, wife, husband, family or staff, here it is below:

 

         

 






                                      

   




NOT READY TO QUIT? 

Then, smoke cleaner and green with BILLYs...

                                               

                                                           PIONEER + AUTHENTIC





We at BILLYs will always preserve the right to smoke, smoke and be free...  



 

                      

Our stretch GOAL is at $50,000 - if we can hit this number we will introduce the BLACK TEA (BILLY 77s) variant option.  With a more bold taste, the BILLY BLACKS will not disappoint.

story:
Know the location!

Introducing "GPS Locator" !

"GPS Locator" is a new generation of personal GPS tracking gadget for kids / elderly / pets /personal asset. It is compact, accurate, discreet, and reliable. With GSM and GPRS network connectivity the GPS Locator works almost anywhere in the world. With mobile app and live tracking function, user can check the position of the tracker anywhere anytime. With SOS panic button and two-way voice functions, you can have voice conversation with kids / elderly whenever they need your help. It is as small as a set of car keys and can be easily placed inside pocket / handbag / suitcase / backpack / etc. 


You will enjoy a piece of mind with knowing exactly where your loved ones or valuable assets are.

Product description

Item specifics:

  • GPS type: GPS Locator
  • Item Size: 45*45*14.6 mm
  • Voltage: 5V
  • Special Feature: Internet Connected
  • Gps Module: Yes
  • Battery Life: 30 Hours & Up
  • SOS button: Supported
  • SIM card requirement: GSM 900/1800/1900 mhz with GPRS data plan
  • Positioning mode: GPS+LBS dual mode
  • Two way voice: Supported


  • Standby time: 96 hours
  • GPS Positioning accuracy: 5-15m
  • Geofence: Supported
  • Waterproof level: IP65

How to install SIM card

SIM card must be 2 G GSM band 900/1800/1900 Mhz with GPRS data plan (data flow of 30 MB/month is enough) and SIM card should not be in debt.
Important note - disable the PIN code by inserting the SIM card into a cellphone first if the SIM card require PIN code. 
Then install the SIM card as is shown in photo below.

Install application on Your smartphone!

For Android - download the app from "Play store" by searching "aibeile" 
For iPhone - download the app from " APP store" by searching "aibeile"

Click the icon "Aibeile" on smartphone and choose "login by ID" mode, then login the ID and the password of the device. And start using the application. 

Default password as well as detailed instruction You will wind in "GPS Locator" Quick User Guide. ID can be found on the silver label on the package.

How to charge?

Connect one end of the charging cable to a USB port of laptop (or 5V power adapter) and the other end to ''GPS Locator" to begin charging. Full charge usually take around 2 hours.

Project timeline

Our project timeline consists of actual and planned period of time. At crowdfunding point we are beginning our planned period. We will do our best to meet set terms.


What We Need & What You Get

We need Your Support:

Your donations will help us to realize our project. But or product will protect many people and pets from missing.

--

(Early Bird) 

1 x ("GPS Locator" + USB / micro USB cable + Screwdriver + Quick User Guide + Gift Box)

61 USD

FREE SHIPPING!

--

1 x ("GPS Locator" + USB / micro USB cable + Screwdriver + Quick User Guide + Gift Box)

66 USD

FREE SHIPPING!

--

2x ("GPS Locator" + USB / micro USB cable + Screwdriver + Quick User Guide + Gift Box)

128 USD

FREE SHIPPING!

--

3 x ("GPS Locator" + USB / micro USB cable + Screwdriver + Quick User Guide + Gift Box)

188 USD

FREE SHIPPING!

--

10 x ("GPS Locator" + USB / micro USB cable + Screwdriver + Quick User Guide + Gift Box)

609 USD

FREE SHIPPING!

--

50 x ("GPS Locator" + USB / micro USB cable + Screwdriver + Quick User Guide + Gift Box)

2845 USD

FREE SHIPPING!

--

100 x ("GPS Locator" + USB / micro USB cable + Screwdriver + Quick User Guide + Gift Box)

5295 USD

FREE SHIPPING!

--

ESTIMATED DELIVERY - 09/2016

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What You Get ?

You get our amazing product - "GPS Locator" and knowing you have helped many other people.

Impact

In this technological era we want to make technology work not only for our comfort, but also for our safety. Join us!

story:
Eliminate Marijuana Smoke & Odors

My friend Sean* smokes in a closet because he has family in the house.  They know he uses medical marijuana, but he doesn't want them breathing in the secondhand smoke.  One of my relatives, Anna, blows her smoke into a garbage bag, then takes all these garbage bags out to the woods behind her house to empty them.  Hector, a co-worker, smokes in the bathroom standing on the toilet so he can blow his smoke up the vent.  These are just a few of the people who inspired me to create the Purostat Exhale.  (*Names have been changed.)

Make MM More Acceptable

Research shows that smoking continues to be the most popular form of ingestion of medical marijuana.  Most smokers already have some method of controlling smoke on the inhale, such as a bong, a one-hitter, or a covered pipe.  The Purostat Exhale complements those devices by controlling smoke on the exhale.  The fact that so many people have been using ad-hoc solutions demonstrates the level of demand for this capability.  With our product, medical marijuana users will be able to smoke anywhere with no smell!

This is personal for me, because I'm a medical marijuana user myself and I live with someone who doesn't use it at all.  One of my missions in life is to address all the issues that non-users have about marijuana.  By supporting this campaign, you are helping make medical marijuana more acceptable to the rest of society!

Where We Are & What We Need

At this point we have a working product that has undergone nearly a year of testing.  We also have our supply chain set up (see photos).  Now we need your help to get the word out and put the Purostat Exhale into the hands of America's 1.5 million medical marijuana users!  We are trying to raise $25,000, which breaks down like this:

  • $15,000 in marketing expenses.  Our target audience consumes more traditional media than social media, so our campaign must include both.  For reference, a media buy in a well-known marijuana-related outlet costs about $3,000 to $10,000 per month.
  • $10,000 in production expenses.  We have a limited inventory that must be expanded to meet sales.  This will pay for 1,000 filters, mouthpieces, housings, and freight.

If we don't reach our goal, we'll produce fewer units and run a shorter campaign.  If we exceed our goal, we'll produce more and run longer.

What You Get

No matter what you contribute, you get our commitment to keep you informed about the effect we're having.  Our goal is to bring cleaner air to the medical marijuana community.  With your help, we are going to do it one Exhale at a time!  If you can't help financially, you can always click "share" or tell your friends about our campaign.

Any contribution of $25 or more will get you a Purostat Exhale, or a 4-Pack if you contribute $79 or more.  If you're raring to get one right now, there are a limited number of units with inventor's signature available for $59.  For those who want to be involved in the design process, you can get your favorite colors put on the next model of the Purostat Exhale for $279.  And for those who are interested in starting and running a web business, I will share what I've learned with you for $579.

Risks & Challenges

At this point, we've gotten over most of the hurdles.  The only remaining risk is that we might not reach enough of our potential customers.  It's a marketing challenge.  Fortunately, I have a background in marketing, and this is a product that I use and believe in.  The Purostat Exhale works.  There is a growing market of people who need what it does.  The challenge is to identify those people and make them aware of our product.

This entails advertising in both traditional and social media.  Once we've generated a certain level of awareness, sales from the website are expected to cover the costs of future advertising.  But to get that started, we need investment.  As I've been going around the country talking to people about the Purostat Exhale, I've been surprised by the level of interest from ordinary people who never invested in a startup before.  That's why I thought Indiegogo would be the perfect place to seek support.

My Background

I have a background in design, psychology, and marketing, including two stints at Harvard.  I've been building and inventing things my whole life, but I didn't understand the business side of it until I started working in Silicon Valley in 2007.  I founded Purostat in 2015 with a mission to make medical marijuana more accessible and more acceptable.

story:
I'm Sending Out an S.O.S.

(Save Orthodontic Smiles)

My name is Dr. Salvatore DeRicco, and I've been frustrated by my orthodontic patients' inability to prevent permanent and unsightly  decalcifications ("White Spot Lesions"), cavities, and swollen gums - around their braces, for over 25 years!  All sorts of toothbrushes, paint-on products, pastes, gels, and rinses - while steps in the right direction, have ultimately proven inadequate.  But I finally  figured out that the product orthodontic patients need, didn't EXIST!  So I invented  it!! 

Here is an image of teeth with moderate decalcifications/White Spot Lesions, following orthodontic treatment - notice that the lesions are primarily concentrated at the backs/bases of the braces - where they meet the enamel, and upwards - to the gumline:

And here is a severe case of decalcification - occurring in the same, typical regions, and including a major cavity:

 

Research has proven that up to 97% of patients with braces will incur some degree of decalcification on one or more teeth, during their time in orthodontic treatment.  This statistic is STAGGERING!!  And the reason is that braces serve as "plaque traps" (a common term) - for food debris, and then "plaque canopies" (my term) - for the trapped debris, by inhibiting conventional toothbrushes and even "orthodontic toothbrushes" from reaching the plaque, by virtue of the designs of the braces and the inadequately-designed toothbrushes.  The SONIC ORTHODONTIC Toothbrush does two things to solve this problem - first, it is designed with only ONE single row of bristles - to fit BEHIND braces - into the very regions where the plaque gets trapped and "sheltered" (as in the next image) , and its SONIC VIBRATIONS (31,000 per minute!) serve to loosen the plaque, so it may be swept away!  It's a very simple mechanical concept, which has eluded orthodontists and orthodontic patients, alike, for more than a CENTURY!

Here is the "money shot" of why this toothbrush is so effective at cleansing the areas where decalcification occurs - ALL of its bristles fit BEHIND all braces, including the obstructive hooks for rubber bands, too!:

In the U.S., alone, it is estimated that 8 million children and adults are wearing braces at any given time.  Contributing to this campaign, and, therefore, the ultimate production of The SONIC ORTHODONTIC Toothbrush, can help them all  reduce their potential to develop this unsightly permanent damage to their teeth!  And if you multiply that by the number of patients who will have braces in the future - for decades to come, and those in the rest of the world, too, together, we can have a tremendous  impact on the future dental health of the WORLD, ultimately affecting BILLIONS of teeth!  McDonalds prides themselves on having "Billions Sold", but we will have "Billions Saved"!!

 

Our Needs and Your Rewards

The molds for the toothbrush heads and handles have already been built, and we (my plant and I) are seeking to raise $13,700 for the final phase of production of the first lot of SONIC ORTHODONTIC Toothbrushes.  As rewards for your contribution, we are offering "Our most heartfelt thanks" and deep  discounts on SONIC ORTHODONTIC Toothbrushes.  The toothbrushes will retail - online, at $68 (plus shipping), and will include two patented  orthodontic brush heads, two standard (non-orthodontic) brush heads - for other family members, and/or after orthodontic treatment is complete, one sonic handle, one electric charger base, and one owner's manual.  For our contributors who donate $48 (plus shipping), they will receive one SONIC ORTHODONTIC Toothbrush; those who donate $80 (plus shipping) will receive two; and those who donate $105 (plus shipping) will receive three.

 

We've covered all the BASES; please help us cover all the BRACES!

The manual (non-sonic) precursor to The SONIC ORTHODONTIC Toothbrush - named The SPOT LESS BRUSH, has been available for two years, (www.Spotless-Smiles.com) and has helped many thousands of orthodontic patients, all over the world.  Adding the sonic vibration was the only possible way to improve on an already effective and successful product, and the logical evolution, in its further development.  We look forward to partnering with you on the development of this even more  revolutionary orthodontic hygiene product! 

 

Thank you and

PLEASE Spread the Word!

Whether or not you are in a position to support this campaign, we sincerely thank you for taking the time to consider  contributing, and we ask that you also consider spreading the word to family, friends, neighbors, etc., because the chances are that you know someone  who is in orthodontic treatment...or at least someone who knows  someone who is in orthodontic treatment, who can benefit from this revolutionary new orthodontic hygiene product.
story_txt:

story:
Q: Can I back this project annoymously?

Yes, Indiegogo gives you the option to donate money to a project anonymously. Just click the “Anonymous” when you donate!

Q: Is Sirens body safe? 

We believe your body deserves top quality! Our product is made of medical grade silicone, the gold standard of sex toy materials. It’s non-porous, easily washable, and hypoallergenic.

Q: How many colors can I choose?

Currently Venus has 3 colors: White, Pink and Blue.

And Ares has just black color.

Q: What is Sensitive feature?

We design the sensor array module structure and embedded software by ourself, which could sense little power from your body and make related reaction. Just like AI, the sex toys will no longer be the toys, but the true partner that know what you want.

Q: Why could the sensitive feature support immersive experience?

For traditional sex toys, we usually control the vibration mode through the key or the app, while it is distraction.

Through the design of our patented tech of sensor, Sirens could be sensitive of your any motion such as stroking, erection etc. and then control the vibration or ballonet thrusting, it is smart! Let you be hands-free to enjoy the immersive orgasms.

Q: Is Sirens compatible with Android devices?

At this point of time Sirens is only compatible with iOS devices. We hope to have an Android version of Sirens in the future.

Q: How is shipping handled? 

We will ship Sirens via the DHL and SF Express.

Q: How much is shipping and handling? 

Ships anywhere in the world and the shipping is free!

Q: When will the Sirens ship to backers?

Venus has already mass production, we will begin shipping when meet the goal.

Ares will begin shipping at Sept.

Q: What happens if I change my address before your ship?

We'll make an announcement 2 weeks before we ship. You'll then be able to update your address on your profile. You can also mail to us in case of emergency: info@sirenstech.com 

Q: Does Sirens have a warranty? 

We are still working out the official terms of the limited warranty, but we intend to replace defective units for at least a one-year period. Due to the nature of the product, we of course cannot accept returns of Sirens once the box has been opened.   

We guarantee you'll receive your Sirens sex toys free of manufacturing defects. We have 100% AQL inspection levels.      

Q: What’s next for Sirens? 

We want to continue to make phenomenal sex toys like Ares and Venus that target real needs; we have lots of ideas and just need to figure out which one to pursue first!

story:
Short Summary

I am laboratory head at the National Research Council of Italy, where I have been studying in the last 15 years the development of neurons in the brain (see info at http://www.inmm.cnr.it/tirone/). One malfunction of the cerebellum development is the growth of medulloblastoma, a devastating and one of the most frequent pediatric tumors. We have recently generated a new model for medulloblastoma and we have observed that is possible to reduce the frequency and extension of medulloblastoma by regulating the migration of the precursors of cerebellar neurons. We have also identified a chemokine,  which regulates the migration of cerebellar precursors and is able to reduce the extension of the medulloblastoma lesions. We need funds to continue a preclinical gene therapy test,  by expressing the chemokine identified by us in the cerebellar precursors of mouse models of spontaneous medulloblastoma, in order to inhibit the growth of medulloblastoma. The preliminary results are very encouraging. This preclinical experiment would open the possibility to use the chemokine in human; our needs are in the range of 70-80.000 US$, as the experiments are long and quite expensive, as they also require the generation of transgenic mouse models and to follow them for three-four years to obtain the statistics of tumor frequency.

However, even a small contribution can allow the project to start; I believe that our findings represent a breakthrough and would offer a chance to cure this tumor. We have published in details our finding in the Journal of Neuroscience, which you can see online (http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23115191).

What We Need & What You Get

We would need 70.000 US$ for the complete experiment, but even 10.000 US$ will allow us to start. The money will be used in part: a) to generate and maintain transgenic mouse models of medulloblastoma expressing the chemokine that can prevent the tumor growth; b) to pay the salary of a young PhD fellow skilled in neuroscience, who will implement and follow the whole experiment fro three-four years. The outcome of this is a novel therapy for medulloblastoma, which represents a breakthrough; in fact, unlike the current treatments, this new therapy it is not trying to control the proliferation of cerebellar precursor neurons, but instead induces their migration outside the surface of cerebellum where the tumor begins. It is a novel therapeutic approach that may have a lower toxicity with respect with chemotherapy and higher efficiency.

In reward, we will acknowledge the names of those who contributed to this project in the outcoming scientific report of our experiments of gene therapy; to major donors, we will also send an handmade notebook or agenda with inscribed the donor's name.

The Impact

Medulloblastoma hits about 1200 children (and also adults) every year only in USA and Europe. The present therapies involve tumor resection, radiotherapy and chemotherapy, which in young patients leave permanent mental deficits. 

In our laboratory we have performed previously two preclinical studies in which we have successfully identified a medulloblastoma suppressor gene, Tis21 (see reference 1) and more recently where we have identified the a new molecule (chemokine) that can reduce medulloblastoma lesions by controlling the migration of cerebellar neurons (reference 2).

Our therapy, if will be demostrated to be effective, is much less invasive than radiotherapy or chemotherapy and can succeed where current therapies fail, because the underlying principle is different.

1) Farioli-Vecchioli et al. 2007. Inhibition of medulloblastoma tumorigenesis by the antiproliferative and pro-differentiative gene PC3. FASEB J. 21:2215-2225.

2) Farioli-Vecchioli et al. 2012. Tis21 knock-out enhances the frequency of medulloblastoma in patched1 heterozygous mice by inhibiting the Cxcl3-dependent migration of cerebellar neurons. J Neurosci. 32:15547-15564.

Risks & Challenges

The critical risk of our project is the timing of delivery to the patient of the chemokine we use. In fact, there is a risk that if the chemokine is vehiculated to the medulloblastoma in a too advanced state, the result is a reduction of the tumor but at the expense of an increase of metastases. That’s why we need to carefully analyze the procedure through a preclinical experiment. For a thorough discussion of the problem see reference (3).

3) Farioli-Vecchioli et al. 2014. Medulloblastoma or not? Crucial role in tumorigenesis of the timing of migration of cerebellar granule precursor cells, regulated by Nos2 and Tis21. Front Neurosci. 6:198

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help:

•  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

•  Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Semi-Colon Group Canada © "We all have mental health"

The "Semi Colon" tattoo worn by tens of thousands of our members represents the fact that "the story is not over" ; there is life after and during any mental illness or challenge.
The "SEMI COLON MOVEMENT"  is a world wide movement; our web site will cater to Canada (and the world).  Currently there is no Semi Colon Group in Canada & we need one.
We offer advise to people that have healed and people that are healing.  That advice will include : legal, fitness, medication, crisis, employment, nutrition 
We need to raise enough money to launch and maintain a networking web site that will allow people to blog about their experiences and share healing advice.
We are open to all faiths and do not wish to profit except to reward the people who maintain the web sight. We appreciate the "free" offers that have been offered but I believe to do justice to such an important cause someone needs to be compensated accordingly. 
We will also offer free services to anyone in need of guidance to achieve wellness.
We do not want to make a profit but will branch out to fund raising events such as art exhibits to help anyone who is healing or has healed from any mental challenge.

I am an open book, please feel free to see :

https://www.linkedin.com/in/maryannebenusisferreira

https://www.facebook.com/mbenusisferreira

thank you;

story:
Dear Community Member,

My name is Nicole Carter AKA Lady Xtreme myself and Big Ben have been DJ's for 15 years and for the past 2 years we have been DJing the Columbus Parks & Recreation Department wheelchair basketball league games. Participants are a spirited group of athletes who do not let their disabilities get in the way of competing to earn the title of tournament champions. They work hard and they play hard. Wheelchair basketball not only gives them an opportunity to improve their athletic skills, but allows them to experience being part of a team, and as any of them will tell you, increases their self-confidence both on and off the court.

Up to this point, the athletes have been playing without any type of uniforms. This year we would like to supply jerseys for all the teams in the league. We believe jerseys will add to the players’ excitement and enjoyment of the game. These uniforms will foster a sense of team unity and belonging. We imagine the level of competition will increase because when our athletes look like champions, they’re going to play like champions. Additionally, fan supporters will be able to more easily identify and cheer for their teams, encouraging and motivating their favorite players.

In order to supply each participant with a reversible jersey, we are looking to raise a total of $4,215 includes design, shipping and handling. Won’t you consider supporting these young men and women by making a donation.

Any size contribution, however, is appreciated.

Thank you for your consideration.

story:
Summary


Hello! My name is Danioska, but you can call me Dani. I’m a 21 year old student of Education majoring in English. I was born with a proximal femoral deficiency of the lower left limb, which means that my left leg didn’t develop properly during my gestation process, resulting in me being born with one leg shorter than the other which had a foot with three tiny toes on it. Despite this, the condition never posed an obstacle and I have been able to lead a normal life as well a sweet childhood surrounded by both family and friends.





I took on my first orthoprothesis when I was only 11 months old. The support and patience my family provided made it so I learned to walk without any help after a while. They have been with me since the very beginning and their support and love has always been present. I grew happily and changed my prosthetic leg from time to time until I became 11 years old. That year, during my annual check up, my doctor realized that my left foot was growing too fast. These were bad news, because the growth meant that soon I wouldn’t be able to walk with a prosthetic.


Up came a solution, an amputation. My parents did everything they could to make it possible and it finally came through. I honestly can’t say that it was easy for me (an 11 year old girl) to withstand the pain and complications that came post surgery. After three months of recovery, we tried once again contemplating the use a prosthetic leg, but unfortunately at that given time we couldn’t afford a new one.


I soon learned to walk by aiding myself with crutches, it was rough at first but after a year I got used to it and became very fast with them! Throughout the years I was focused on school and aiming to get excellent grades (which I did). I have always loved foreign languages, so I took an English course during my senior year of high school. When I got to graduate from high school (back in 2010) I soon realized that my passion was helping people, as well teaching them how to communicate in a foreign language.


In order to support my family, at the age of 16, I started working for an important newspaper as soon as I graduated from high school. My days were spent half time working and the other half going to college.


As you can see, I’m just an ordinary young woman with a not so ordinary condition that has never represented a limitation. Nowadays, after 10 years of using crutches I want to change my lifestyle once again, simply go back to using a prosthetic leg and together with my college degree, seeking the promise of a better future where I can do more things than I already do.


Even then, it’s been so long since I last wore prosthesis so my muscles have become weak. This is the reason I need rehab prior to using prosthesis once again. The process would start as soon as possible and there is a high chance that by the time I get my college degree (July, 2016) I could be walking again, which is very exciting for me and represents the beginning of the new life that awaits me and I’ve been yearning for!



What We Need & the Possibilities

The funds obtained with this campaign will be used in several ways. One of them would be the payment of my physical therapies which are needed throughout then entire process. The second one and most important is the purchase of the materials needed in order to build my prosthetic leg in my country. After speaking with my technician (Richard Rosales, who has been with me through this whole journey), he suggested several parts such as the knee 3R95 found in Ottobock (which can be found in several places around the world but are not present in Venezuela). This would imply that the expenses include shipping of every single part since both the building of the prosthesis and therapy will be done here, in my country. This remains my one and only option because they’re simply not available where I currently reside.


All the funds raised by this campaign will go towards the purchase of my prosthetic leg and my rehabilitation process but in the event of raising more than we initially needed (considering this is an approximate), I plan to donate the money to an organization in charge of helping people in situations such as mine to help bring a solution to their lives.

The Impact

I’m a very proactive person who is always willing to help. My sole goal in life is to continue growing academically after my college graduation so I can be prepared to give my very best to all my future students. Having the opportunity to improve the quality of my life by using once again a prosthetic leg gives me hope and an optimist outlook towards everything that awaits me in the future. At the same time, I have been dealing with health issues due to the extended use and pressure I put on my right leg, which results in terrible back pain among others and hinders my daily life as well my productivity.

With your assistance I can come through all of this and I would definitely lead a life that will change in every possible way towards something better. I’ll be more than willing to share this journey with these wanting to keep in contact and follow my progress and at the same time I will be more than happy to get to know some of the generous people who have decided to help me make my dream come true.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re financially unable to aid me, you can still help by sharing my story and campaign with everyone you can! Spreading the word does a lot by itself and it will definitely help me out in my journey. Any way you want, through any social media, I will gladly appreciate it.


Anything goes! Please spread the word and bring light to my life once again!

-Dani
story_txt:
SummaryHello! My name is Danioska, but you can call me Dani. I’m a 21 year old student of Education majoring in English. I was born with a proximal femoral deficiency of the lower left limb, which means that my left leg didn’t develop properly during my gestation process, resulting in me being born with one leg shorter than the other which had a foot with three tiny toes on it. Despite this, the condition never posed an obstacle and I have been able to lead a normal life as well a sweet childhood surrounded by both family and friends.

I took on my first orthoprothesis when I was only 11 months old. The support and patience my family provided made it so I learned to walk without any help after a while. They have been with me since the very beginning and their support and love has always been present. I grew happily and changed my prosthetic leg from time to time until I became 11 years old. That year, during my annual check up, my doctor realized that my left foot was growing too fast. These were bad news, because the growth meant that soon I wouldn’t be able to walk with a prosthetic.Up came a solution, an amputation. My parents did everything they could to make it possible and it finally came through. I honestly can’t say that it was easy for me (an 11 year old girl) to withstand the pain and complications that came post surgery. After three months of recovery, we tried once again contemplating the use a prosthetic leg, but unfortunately at that given time we couldn’t afford a new one.I soon learned to walk by aiding myself with crutches, it was rough at first but after a year I got used to it and became very fast with them! Throughout the years I was focused on school and aiming to get excellent grades (which I did). I have always loved foreign languages, so I took an English course during my senior year of high school. When I got to graduate from high school (back in 2010) I soon realized that my passion was helping people, as well teaching them how to communicate in a foreign language.
In order to support my family, at the age of 16, I started working for an important newspaper as soon as I graduated from high school. My days were spent half time working and the other half going to college.As you can see, I’m just an ordinary young woman with a not so ordinary condition that has never represented a limitation. Nowadays, after 10 years of using crutches I want to change my lifestyle once again, simply go back to using a prosthetic leg and together with my college degree, seeking the promise of a better future where I can do more things than I already do.Even then, it’s been so long since I last wore prosthesis so my muscles have become weak. This is the reason I need rehab prior to using prosthesis once again. The process would start as soon as possible and there is a high chance that by the time I get my college degree (July, 2016) I could be walking again, which is very exciting for me and represents the beginning of the new life that awaits me and I’ve been yearning for!
What We Need & the PossibilitiesThe funds obtained with this campaign will be used in several ways. One of them would be the payment of my physical therapies which are needed throughout then entire process. The second one and most important is the purchase of the materials needed in order to build my prosthetic leg in my country. After speaking with my technician (Richard Rosales, who has been with me through this whole journey), he suggested several parts such as the knee 3R95 found in Ottobock (which can be found in several places around the world but are not present in Venezuela). This would imply that the expenses include shipping of every single part since both the building of the prosthesis and therapy will be done here, in my country. This remains my one and only option because they’re simply not available where I currently reside.
All the funds raised by this campaign will go towards the purchase of my prosthetic leg and my rehabilitation process but in the event of raising more than we initially needed (considering this is an approximate), I plan to donate the money to an organization in charge of helping people in situations such as mine to help bring a solution to their lives.The ImpactI’m a very proactive person who is always willing to help. My sole goal in life is to continue growing academically after my college graduation so I can be prepared to give my very best to all my future students. Having the opportunity to improve the quality of my life by using once again a prosthetic leg gives me hope and an optimist outlook towards everything that awaits me in the future. At the same time, I have been dealing with health issues due to the extended use and pressure I put on my right leg, which results in terrible back pain among others and hinders my daily life as well my productivity.With your assistance I can come through all of this and I would definitely lead a life that will change in every possible way towards something better. I’ll be more than willing to share this journey with these wanting to keep in contact and follow my progress and at the same time I will be more than happy to get to know some of the generous people who have decided to help me make my dream come true.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you’re financially unable to aid me, you can still help by sharing my story and campaign with everyone you can! Spreading the word does a lot by itself and it will definitely help me out in my journey. Any way you want, through any social media, I will gladly appreciate it.Anything goes! Please spread the word and bring light to my life once again!-Dani

story:
Short Summary

Hi, we are a small Startup from India, and together with Novamem in Switzerland we are bringing clean and portable water to India.
With our portable water filters - DrinkPure - anyone in India can purify water on the spot. They are save, durable, and can used many many times. 
We want to produce these filter very affordable, locally in India and distribute them. 
As it is important to us to help people who can still not afford these filter, we are giving the DrinkPures funded by this campaign for free to kids in local, public schools, where is no access to clean drinking water. 

What We Need & What You Get

What we have to do, in order to produce the filters, is:

  • We need to order some machines (a welding and a cutting machine)
  • We need to hire some people who work the machines and help us with marketing and distribution
  • We need to order all the single parts
  • We have to make sure many people hear about the filters and get convinced that the filters actually work
In order for this to be done, we need around 20.000 $. As more money we can invest, as more parts we can order and as cheaper every single filter will be in the end. 
In return for a contribution, you can help kids in public schools here, or there are also options for you to get your very own filter and see how awesome it works. 


How does it work? Is it magic? Are you wizards?

Nah, it's much easier. In the filter are multiple filtration layers. The most important one is a membrane, developed by the ETH Zurich and the spin-off Novamem. You can imagine it like a plastic foil, with tiny tiny holes in it, just a few nano meters. And everything that is bigger than this mesh will stay out, while the water can flow through. So you get clean, safe water. Due to the novel and high performance membrane, the filter can be very small and operated with just a little bit of pressure, a hand-squeeze is just enough go get a nice flow rate. And once too much dirt accumulates on the membrane, it is simply washed back and as good as new!


The Impact

India is currently facing a huge water crisis. There are 97 million people in India without access to improved drinking water and over 21% of the country's diseases are water-related. That means a lot of people getting sick every day, and a lot of people at still dying every day, just due to bad drinking water. 
We want to give people a tool, to filter their own water, reliable and cost-efficient. Without being dependent on energy or regular deliveries of chemicals, or skilled personal to operate heavy machines. 
And we also want to give NGO's or companies an easy opportunity, to quickly boost the standard of living for as many people as they want, by simply providing these simple and easy-to-use-filters to them. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge for us is probably the huge amount of people who still lack clean water in India. The numbers are simply gigantic. But it is also an opportunity for us, to try to help as many of them as possible. 

Another issue is to convince people that our water is save. As you can't see bacteria, and people traditionally don't put too much trust into company advertisement. They are probably even right with that, as all kind of questionable things are sold in India as water purifier... But it will need a lot of demonstrations and mouth-to-mouth-advertisement in order to establish a certain level of trust to our filter. 


Other Ways You Can Help

So, if you can't contribute directly to our campaign and still want to help, there is still a lot to do:

  • Tell your friends and your family about us
  • Press some like- and share-buttons (they are everywhere, even on this page)
  • Tell us that you like what we do. That keeps us going ;)
  • Tell people who are influential, or maybe they know someone who knows someone... you know? Spread the word
  • If you have any ideas how we can do things better, or you have good ideas for the future, let us know

story:
INTRODUCTION

Thank you for checking in on my page.  My spiritual name is Luna Phoenix.  Luna, Spanish for Moon, is not only to signify my Spanish heritage but also my sense of humor for teaching nude yoga.  It also signifies my dedication to you.  The Moon reflects the Light from the Sun to shine upon the Earth.  My job is to be the reflection of light that is shown upon me from you. I make it my goal to reflect the light in all who I meet.  Phoenix reflects my life.  I have been down many times in my life and risen again from the ashes brighter and stronger than before. I am the co-Owner, Managing Director and Main Instructor of NuReveal Yoga. I am an Intuitive and Ordained Minister who is a NASM Certified Personal Trainer as well as a Registered Yoga Alliance Certified Yoga Instructor.  I hold a Black Belt in Tae Kwon Do and a Brown belt in Chung Do Kwan.  Currently, I am studying to obtain my Reiki Master certification.  

I teach yoga in both clothed and unclothed formats.  My nude yoga helps individuals to enhance the union of the spiritual, emotional and physical plane in a naturist/nudist state using an unmasking ceremony.  We see nudity as a natural state not as a sexual being.  We peel off the mayas (illusions) of the identity we place on ourselves to return us back to the original state.  I teach the nude yoga to remove the sexual stigma on the naked body.  Here in NuReveal Yoga, we work hard to change the culture into accepting the nude body as a protective shell of a Spiritual being. I love YOGA and I love what it has done for me in regards to confidence, self image, appreciation of life, gratitude, freedom and healing from past sexual abuse I have suffered especially through nude yoga.   Nude yoga allowed me to reclaim my body as my own and as a divine creation deserving to be treated as a physical vessel to a deeper, more spiritually connected being inside. 

In clothed yoga, I teach both adults and children.  I try to demonstrate movements, philosophies that assist individuals to live better lives.  I use my knowledge from Personal Training and Martial Arts Training to assist to design Yoga programs according to individual’s needs.  

I occasionally write blogs on nurevealyoga.wordpress.com and have written articles for Velocity Magazine, formerly a free bimonthly Central Florida magazine. 

WHAT IS THIS CAMPAIGN ABOUT?

I currently hold a weekly co-ed nude yoga class in the Downtown Orlando area.  I am looking to expand my business and move my headquarters to St. John's County.  St. John's County currently holds an anti-nudity law that may or may not prohibit NuReveal Yoga from teaching there.  As mentioned above, I teach nude fitness for an increased body awareness and awakening.  Movements are nonrestrictive.  The individual can achieve many physiological as well as physical benefits from working out nude.  Physical: the feet will develop stronger muscles for stability.  One will be able to see without restrictions which muscle are or need to be moving in the movement.  Physiological Benefits: Sense of freedom; Increased Body awareness and acceptance; Decrease in seeing the body as purely as a sexual entity.

Refer to these articles for more information: 

http://www.livescience.com/14971-naked-yoga-stretches-esteem-healthy.html
http://www.dreampositive.info/psychological-benefits-naked-yoga/
http://www.thehealthsite.com/fitness/naked-yoga-does-it-have-any-real-health-benefits-k114/

I have acquired an attorney to discuss the issue with the St. John's County board members to get a clarification of the law and see if we can have permission to teach there.  If not, we would have to go to court to battle a variance out which can be costly.  The funds I am currently asking for is just for the start up.  I am hoping for a quick resolution without it becoming too costly.  If funds collected are more than we are asking (thank you by the way for your generosity), we would love to use the remaining funds to build or rent a facility that can accommodate co-ed nude students with a safe, secured climate controlled environment as well as an online "LIVE" classroom.  However, right now we are just looking for the first phase of our plans and have a legal discussion with the Board of St. John's County.

With the approval from the Board, NuReveal Yoga hopes to serve the First Coast Naturist Group located in North Florida, American Association of Nude Recreation (AANR) and The Naturist Foundation (TNF) members nationwide, and other individuals interested in learning their body in a different, more spiritual way and changing the worldview of a nude body being anything more than a natural occurrence.  NuReveal Yoga help sexual abuse victims to become survivor as I have. I have taught soldiers how to break free from their PTSD symptoms with some of NuReveal's techniques as well.  We wish to serve as therapeutic option to the Naturist, Nudist and general communities. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and we definitely understand that but it would be really great and would HELP us tremendously if you spread the word of our cause and growth.  Please use the SHARE TOOLS available.  THANKS AND NAMASTE.

story:
Short Summary

For this year's Old Mutual Two Oceans Marathon I will be raising money to assist Run For A Cure Africa with their breast cancer awareness and therapy campaigns. The marathon will be 56km (not the usual 42.2km); the longest I will have run in my life.

In Africa, a breast cancer diagnosis is almost a death sentence. Run For A Cure's vision is to turn the current 90% mortality rate to a 90% survival rate, something which has been achieved in other parts of the world.

The Impact

Run For A Cure Africa offer the following services:

Community Outreach - Seeks to dispel myths and stigmas associated with breast cancer through various community outreach programs

Breast Screenings - Hosts breast cancer screening exercises at no cost to the participants

Treatment - Supports women who cannot afford to pay for breast cancer treatment and helps these same women and their families shoulder the emotional and psychological burden breast cancer can present

Risks & Challenges

I have entered the Old Mutual Two Oceans Marathon. I will be paying my way for flights, accommodation, sustenance etc. I am also currently running approximately 200km a month in preparation for the race. Despite all this preparation, and whilst it might be extremely unlikely, there are risks which may stop me from completing the run. These include should: 

  • I may suffer a serious injury before or during my planned run
  • I may suffer from an illness and not be fully recovered on the day of the run

story:
The Color Light Therapy in Sensosphere may be used as a support in numerous Mind and Body ailments related to stress, including :

  • Bringing back the feeling of serenity, positivity and wellness (decreasing the feeling of stress, anxiety or mental distress)
  • Helping with sleep difficulties
  • Support Recovery
  • Improving attention and ability to focus
  • Helping with pain release and management

 

The Beginning of SensoSphere

The patented 'Light Modulation' technology used, has been developed over a period of many years by Anadi A. Martel; Physicist, Inventor and Electronics Wizard.  After establishing a solid scientific foundation through his Graduate studies in Physics, he went on to live in an ashram in India for a few years.

Since then, he has been applying his knowledge of electronics and computers to the development of instruments working in novel ways with sound and light. His Spatial Sound Processors have been used worldwide by professionals in psychoacoustics, multimedia, and cinema. His work has led to patents in the field of Light Modulation, and recently in LED-based design. He has worked as a hi-tech design consultant for various companies such as Disney World, Cirque du Soleil, Imax and OSIM International and continues his work on Sensora Systems and SensoSphere along with his other professional products. He is also president of the International Light Association. He will be releasing his new Book entitled “The Power of Light” The Dawn of a New Medicine.

A therapist well-known both in Canada and abroad from working with Tantra and Shamanism, Ma Premo is the co-creator of the Sensora multi-sensorial system. Using these unique light and sound instruments, she has over the last 30 years built up a wealth of experience in helping people. She has been leading transformational and meditation groups and trainings around the world and has also participated in numerous international projects, including live shows, and art and museum installations, as a consultant and facilitator.
 
Ma Premo has developed a unique way of using light for integrative therapy, focusing on colors’ innate abilities to evoke pure joy and delight, thereby stimulating the brain’s flow of pleasure-related neurotransmitters. This approach contributes to restoring inner homeostasis, an essential component of the healing process in areas as varied as depression, burn-out, PTSD, insomnia, chronic pain, anxiety, addiction and more.

 

Technology Behind SensoSphere

There are many skeptics to any form of alternative medicine and therapy that is not based on pharma solutions. However, there are many signs that non-invasive therapy is gaining a lot of attention around the world. Since 2000, we have seen increases in the thousands of scientific medical articles on Light Therapy. In 2010 alone, there were over 8000 articles mentioning or referring to light. Today, there are many companies and products within this therapeutic field that are designed to treat various conditions related to health.

We are now being exposed to the multiple benefits of Light Therapy in all forms of media. For all those seeking to understand how our Chromotherapy works, we have created a video collection referred to as Therapeutic Applications of Light that can be found here. It is scientific, but I encourage you to view the history of light and the science community behind the progress.

These videos are presented by Physicist Anadi Martel. Your understanding of the technology described as ‘Light Modulation’ used in SensoSphere is important to gain confidence in the use of our device.

 

Chromotherapy (Color Light Therapy)

Color Light Therapy, or Chromotherapy, is a recognized therapeutic method that has been used for centuries to help cure diseases and relieve ailments (Azeemi and Raza, 2005). The effects of light on the human body include influence on the brain’s visual cortex (i.e. perception and consciousness), influence on our hormonal system, as well as a deep influence on the circadian, neuroendocrine, and on neurobehavioral regulation (Anadi A. Martel, 2015). Moreover, light penetrates within the skin rather than only touching the surface, and thus influences cellular biochemistry (Anadi A. Martel, 2015).

 

Research on Chromotherapy

Anadi A. Martel. (2015). Therapeutic Applications of Light. Part 1: Action Pathways of Light. Retrieved September 8, 2016, from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGL3sHepxjs

Azeemi, S. T., & Raza, S. M. (2005). A Critical Analysis of Chromotherapy and Its Scientific Evolution. Retrieved September 08, 2016, from http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1297510/

 

Other Resources on Chromotherapy

  • Video Resources explaining Color Light Therapy
  • Ostekin (2015) | Therapeutic Effects of Oligonol, Acupuncture, and Quantum Light Therapy in Chronic Nonbacterial Prostatitis
  • Edelhäuser (2015) | Impact of colored light on cardiorespiratory coordination
  • Schaefer (2006) | The effect of colored illumination on heart rate variability

 

Light Modulation

The important principle of SensoSphere, one of multiple, that separates our product from other Color Light Therapy technologies, is Sensortech Inc.’s patented ‘Light Modulation’ technology. This system allows the embedding of soft light pulsations for specific interaction with our various physiological rhythms, such as brainwaves, breath, and heartbeat.

 

Clinical Study on 'Light Modulation'

A clinical study on the effects of colored light projections based on Sensortech’s Light Modulation technology, as used in SensoSphere, was published in 2013 by Dr. M.J. Ross, Dr. P. Guthrie (Midwestern State University, Texas, USA), and J.C. Dumont (Trinity Western University, BC, Canada) in Advances in Mind & Body Medicine Journal.
 

The Impact of Modulated, Colored Light on the Autonomic Nervous System: A detailed report can be acquired through Advances in Mind-Body medicine journal, reference to Fall 2013 Vol 27 No4.

  1. Results Summary: 2013. Clinical Research on Light Modulation. Results Summary
  2. Our clinical study abstract is on Pubmed: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/24067320

 

Other Studies on 'Light Modulation'

Some of these studies were conducted by the use of professional ‘Sensora Systems’ using ‘Light Modulation’ technology and now also being used in SensoSphere. We will keep adding SensoSphere case studies as we receive them. We welcome all users of SensoSphere to participate in our Case Studies.

  • 2013. Power of Light: Case Studies. International Light Association
  • FOUR CASE STUDIES ON OUR LIGHT THERAPY TECHNOLOGY
  1. Kirlian Research on the Effects of Sensora (2013)
  2. Insomnia Relief using Sensora light therapy (2013)
  3. Chronic pain management using Sensora light therapy (2012)
  4. Kirlian Research on the Effects of Sensora  (2012)

 

 

How does SensoSphere incorporate these concepts?

 

SensoSphere is built with 21 individual PCB boards incorporating 17 independent light sources (34 multicolor Led’s). A total of 51 individual channels all use unique high-precision analog led drive circuitry, without any PWM (Pulse Width Modulation).

Complex algorithms embedded in the ARM processor controls the light constantly, with subtle random color light variations, that emit pure non-polluting light conducive to the light therapy effects desired. The globe is custom-made polycarbonate with soft touch coating for maximum diffusion and no reflection. It includes precision sensors for your interface control features.

Music and Touch interactivity will allow you to modify the light patterns in lively and unpredictable ways. The interface control features including Mode selection of Balance, Energy, Relaxation, and Mono are all made by easy hand motions around the globe and equator. It also controls the on/off, brightness, Mono color selection and music interface.  

 

Using SensoSphere with Hand Gestures

 

 

Certifications & Memberships

 

 

Sensora Systems Worldwide

Professional Locations

(partial list only)

 

Lead Team Members

Tom Demyk – President of Demyk Lightmod Products Inc., CEO Engineering, Manufacturing, and Marketing

About Tom Demyk:

Thomas Demyk is President of Demyk Lightmod Products Inc. and operates under StressLightTherapy.com. Leads a team of individuals that are dedicated, to making our company and products better known and seen as bettering the lives of all people, through Mind & Body health. A long background working with multinational companies such as Texas Instruments, Motorola, and Philips in a capacity of management and Engineering Sales of Advanced technologies. Proud father of two with two grandchildren. Member of International Light Association.  

Anadi A. Martel – President of Sensortech Inc., Physicist, Inventor, Engineering, Speaker, Patent holder and Consultant

Ma Premo – Therapist Consultant

Jackie Thomas – Director of Social Media

Hanna Demyk – Lead Graphic Designer

 

Indiegogo Campaign Goals

  • Raise $25,000 US in funds through a 40-day Indiegogo campaign,

  • increase awareness of our products and the underlying technology, and

  • show that Chromotherapy and ‘Light Modulation’ can help many individuals who suffer from stress, associated ailments, sleeping disorders and more.

 

Campaign Timeline

 

FAQs

Where can I get more information on your products?
You can visit our website at www.stresslighttherapy.com

Who owns this Website and what is their connection to this product?
The Website is owned by Demyk Lightmod Product Inc. which is licensed for manufacturing and marketing of SensoSphere worldwide. We have been in operation since 2014.

Where is this product being sold and how do we purchase it in North America?
SensoSphere is being sold in Europe and across North America. In North America, we provide direct order entry on our Website for individual consumers and practitioners to use in their clinics. In North America and Europe, we have distributors and continue to expand our network. We welcome your inquiries from both distributors and practitioners.

Where is this product manufactured?
This product is manufactured in Canada with quality components and certified UL North America and CE for Europe.

What is your Warranty?
We provide one-year limited Warranty as described below.

What other areas outside ‘Senior Citizen Health’ campaign can this Color Light Therapy be used in?

  • An area of high interest is “Youth” and we have multiple locations using this product for ailments such as ADD, ADHD, and CBT among others. Interest is from parents with behavioral problems with their children. We are working on providing Case Studies with specifics based on protocol formats. Our device in Energy mode provides the ability for longer study periods and greater creative capacity. We also welcome candidates to participate and support our efforts further.
  • We are working on school programs that will benefit from the effects of this non-invasive therapy on their students principally, but also for the benefit of teachers’ interface with students and progress with their study curriculum.
  • We are seeing interest in many Meditation practices using it for class ambiance and complementary to improving their students exercise retention which it provides.
  • Another key area is the general population for our working class as a Stress reliever and increased creative capacity it affords in Energy Mode.
  • We have seen a lot of interest, from parents and students on using the Light Therapy device for its ability to provide the Energy needed for studying. Results are the ability for longer study periods and greater creative capacity.

Why do we not see endorsements?
This product is being introduced to North America at this time. It does take time and resources to spread the word on this technology. That is one of the other reasons we are launching this campaign. You can be sure we are working on different fronts to address this issue. We welcome any suggestions and cooperation on this front.

Do you have new products being developed?
We do have several new products being developed and will be introduced in 2017.

How do we know your product works as indicated?
We have Case Studies and Clinical Study for you to view. Furthermore, we will be adding new materials as we receive them. All case studies must be completed by professional practitioners, verified and permission granted to show.

For a better understanding, and to gain confidence in the ability of our product, we believe that all interested individuals should first understand the technology as explained in our Video selections, called ‘Therapeutic Applications of Light’. Although it is scientific, you can see the long history of Light and the community of Scientists involved including ours. Our chromotherapy product is based on ‘Light Modulation’ that is being used in multiple professional health clinics worldwide using Sensora Systems. The degree of effectiveness always varies with individuals based on severity and type of ailment, and dedication to proper usage of device. In all cases, usage of this device does not replace a physicians’ advice or viewing this device as a medical solution.    


Warranty Information

DEMYK LIGHTMOD PRODUCTS INC. warrants that the product will be free of defects in material and workmanship which cause the product to fail to operate in accordance to instructions set forth in documentation, USER’S MANUAL. The warranty period is for one year from date of consumer purchase and is limited to the repair or replacement of this product only and does not extend to consequential or incremental damage related to the use of this product.

Disclaimer

To be clear, SensoSphere Color Light Therapy, should not be considered as a medical replacement or advice from your physician. It should be considered as a complementary therapeutic aid for your Mind and Body health as it was designed for. This device is not recommended for individuals suffering from Migraine headaches or other related conditions brought on by Flashing Light bursts.
story_txt:
The Color Light Therapy in Sensosphere may be used as a support in numerous Mind and Body ailments related to stress, including :

Bringing back the feeling of serenity, positivity and wellness (decreasing the feeling of stress, anxiety or mental distress)
Helping with sleep difficulties
Support Recovery
Improving attention and ability to focus
Helping with pain release and management


 
The Beginning of SensoSphere

The patented 'Light Modulation' technology used, has been developed over a period of many years by Anadi A. Martel; Physicist, Inventor and Electronics Wizard.  After establishing a solid scientific foundation through his Graduate studies in Physics, he went on to live in an ashram in India for a few years.
Since then, he has been applying his knowledge of electronics and computers to the development of instruments working in novel ways with sound and light. His Spatial Sound Processors have been used worldwide by professionals in psychoacoustics, multimedia, and cinema. His work has led to patents in the field of Light Modulation, and recently in LED-based design. He has worked as a hi-tech design consultant for various companies such as Disney World, Cirque du Soleil, Imax and OSIM International and continues his work on Sensora Systems and SensoSphere along with his other professional products. He is also president of the International Light Association. He will be releasing his new Book entitled “The Power of Light” The Dawn of a New Medicine.
A therapist well-known both in Canada and abroad from working with Tantra and Shamanism, Ma Premo is the co-creator of the Sensora multi-sensorial system. Using these unique light and sound instruments, she has over the last 30 years built up a wealth of experience in helping people. She has been leading transformational and meditation groups and trainings around the world and has also participated in numerous international projects, including live shows, and art and museum installations, as a consultant and facilitator. Ma Premo has developed a unique way of using light for integrative therapy, focusing on colors’ innate abilities to evoke pure joy and delight, thereby stimulating the brain’s flow of pleasure-related neurotransmitters. This approach contributes to restoring inner homeostasis, an essential component of the healing process in areas as varied as depression, burn-out, PTSD, insomnia, chronic pain, anxiety, addiction and more.
 
Technology Behind SensoSphere


There are many skeptics to any form of alternative medicine and therapy that is not based on pharma solutions. However, there are many signs that non-invasive therapy is gaining a lot of attention around the world. Since 2000, we have seen increases in the thousands of scientific medical articles on Light Therapy. In 2010 alone, there were over 8000 articles mentioning or referring to light. Today, there are many companies and products within this therapeutic field that are designed to treat various conditions related to health.
We are now being exposed to the multiple benefits of Light Therapy in all forms of media. For all those seeking to understand how our Chromotherapy works, we have created a video collection referred to as Therapeutic Applications of Light that can be found here. It is scientific, but I encourage you to view the history of light and the science community behind the progress.
These videos are presented by Physicist Anadi Martel. Your understanding of the technology described as ‘Light Modulation’ used in SensoSphere is important to gain confidence in the use of our device. Chromotherapy (Color Light Therapy)Color Light Therapy, or Chromotherapy, is a recognized therapeutic method that has been used for centuries to help cure diseases and relieve ailments (Azeemi and Raza, 2005). The effects of light on the human body include influence on the brain’s visual cortex (i.e. perception and consciousness), influence on our hormonal system, as well as a deep influence on the circadian, neuroendocrine, and on neurobehavioral regulation (Anadi A. Martel, 2015). Moreover, light penetrates within the skin rather than only touching the surface, and thus influences cellular biochemistry (Anadi A. Martel, 2015). Research on ChromotherapyAnadi A. Martel. (2015). Therapeutic Applications of Light. Part 1: Action Pathways of Light. Retrieved September 8, 2016, from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGL3sHepxjsAzeemi, S. T., & Raza, S. M. (2005). A Critical Analysis of Chromotherapy and Its Scientific Evolution. Retrieved September 08, 2016, from http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1297510/ Other Resources on Chromotherapy
Video Resources explaining Color Light Therapy
Ostekin (2015) | Therapeutic Effects of Oligonol, Acupuncture, and Quantum Light Therapy in Chronic Nonbacterial Prostatitis
Edelhäuser (2015) | Impact of colored light on cardiorespiratory coordination
Schaefer (2006) | The effect of colored illumination on heart rate variability
