story:
The MISIG Story 

We started shipping the MISIG April, 2016 and as writing this there are 61 PGA, LPGA and PGA Champions Tour Professionals using the MISIG and one of the things your donation will do is help secure sponsorship deals. There are a lot of BIG NAMES in the golf world using the MISIG. We are blessed to have a PGA Tour Representative "behind the ropes" at some of the biggest PGA Tournaments in the world.

My name is Bernie Fay and I am the Inventor of the MISIG or "Most Important Stretch In Golf." It's a simple yet profound device that really helps golfers of all ages and skill levels. I invented it out of desperation. You see when I was 12 years old I broke my humerus bone (bone between shoulder and elbow) and today it is very arthritic. Because of this I had lost my back swing. I kept trying to figure out what could help me get that back.

Just over a year ago,  I was in my garage stretching my left arm when I spotted a bungee cord on a work bench. Ever the inquisitive experimenter, I tied the cord to my elbow and started pulling it up and away from my body. It was a fantastic stretch.  I soon began thinking about how to develop what I just discovered into a better functioning system of stretching and turning.

After a dozen trips to the hardware store and numerous purchases of stretch cords and other parts from the internet, I created a rather unsightly prototype. It consisted of PVC pipe and surgical tubing with a load of awkward nuts and bolts. It was very ugly, but it worked!

Just a few weeks later, I was swinging with minimal pain and had extended the length of my back swing considerably. I continued tweaking the design, and a few months after this eureka moment in the garage, I applied for a patent. Shortly after that, I began showing it around, and a local PGA professional told me it was a perfect tool for students looking to establish an in-to-in swing path.  He wishes beginners, before picking up a club, would start with this for a month. It's that effective.

What We Need & What You Get

I am trying to raise $250,000 to increase production and and pay for television commercial production and air time. We also want to sign PGA Professionals to sponsorship deals. 

By donating to my campaign, you will inevitably be helping golfers around the world improve their game, have less injuries & fatigue and enjoy the game of golf more. My new invention, the MISIG is a "Game Improvement" tool for golfers of all ages and skill levels around the world.

The MISIG Impact

A customer named Tom Hardy told me the MISIG gave him back what time took away.  He's retired and says he gets better range of motion, more degrees out of his back swing, and better inside to out swing using the MISIG.

- The Best Warm Up and Game Improvement Tool A Golfer Can Use. "Lengthen, strengthen and train your swing with this clever device." Editors GOLF.com

We introduced the MISIG at the PGA Merchandise Show in January and the Golf Channel's Lauren Thompson s picked the MISIG as the best new product at the show. "I love this! It's something you can do indoors or outdoors." Lauren Thompson - Golf Channel 

Fourteen time PGA Tour winner Hal Sutton  was across the aisle from us at the PGA show. We gave him a MISIG and he loved it. He wrote a beautiful letter which reads in part "As we age anything that helps us loosen up is a benefit to us. The "Feel The Stretch" does it well, and while taking your swing. GREAT DEVICE!"

We were able to attend three golf shows in the Midwest in the early part of the year and I am so proud to say that one out of every three people that tried the MISIG bought it!

Up until now my wife and I have been funding this with our life savings and there are still many hurdles to cross, but I know that with the help of people like you it will be a worldwide success.   Please make a contribution using the BACK IT button at the top of the page.

Kindest Regards,

Bernie Fay                                 

www.feelthestretch.com

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your financial support for our campaign is immensely valuable to helping get this product to market!

However, that's not all we are asking!

PLEASE take advantage of Indiegogo's share tools to share this campaign with your friends, families, and social networks in order to help us spread the word!

PLEASE visit our FACEBOOK PAGE and LIKE and SHARE our page and our posts!

And PLEASE, if you know of any blogs, news sites, golf pages, or other outlets that would be interested in our story, put them in touch with us!

Thank You

story:
Empowering Women

Daughter Of The Soil is a contemporary skincare range with its roots firmly in Africa

The first UK natural skincare brand distinctly showcasing African heritage and giving back to the community where the botanical oils are sourced.  Each African oil has its own heritage story, having been used for centuries by local communities to nourish, moisturise and protect their skin. Daughter of the Soil skincare range celebrates the heritage of these natural oils, completing their story. We believe this truly defines our proposition.

We believe that the key to our success is ensuring an uncompromising commitment to the quality of our product, strong brand ethical and moral commitment, investment into the source of the produce materials, and the ability to develop and distribute our product to meet short lead times and high demand needs.

The Social Mission

The social mission, 'Connect the DOTS'  is to put back into the continent that yields such powerful ingredients for the range. The founders of the Company pledge a percentage of profits and equity to social programme Connect the DOTS which will deliver a certified functional training programme for marginalised women in Africa.

Designed to empower women in agriculture by giving them the ability to earn an income. The goal is to have 10 million DOTS certified women working in Africa by 2025.

Our Campaign

The below range of product bundles gives you the chance to try the range ahead of its UK launch, as well as helping the team in its aim to Empower Women in Africa.

Our story began with a vision to showcase some of Africa’s most unique and treasured botanical ingredients so that women can look supremely beautiful on the outside whilst always giving back to the communities that give those treasures to us.

We have invested our own savings to getting the product range developed for launch, ensuring they are 100% natural, as well as creating our e-commerce platform and brand. The funding we receive from this campaign will be used to introduce more people to the range, primarily through a pop up store in central London in the busy Christmas shopping period.

As well as

  • Financing the set up and fit out costs for our London based pop up shop
  • Attaining the SOIL accreditation for all our products
  • Delivering our marketing plan
  • Free samples
  • Social media campaign
  • PR coverage
  • Natural cosmetic and beauty exhibitions/conferences (both regional and national)

Exceeding our target will enable us to kick off new product development adding to our portfolio and getting the Connect the DOTS initiative off the ground sooner.

By supporting this campaign, you will not only be treating your skin to a luxurious new experience, but you’ll be getting a big social mission off the ground.
story_txt:
Empowering Women
Daughter Of The Soil is a contemporary skincare range with its roots firmly in Africa
The first UK natural skincare brand distinctly showcasing African heritage and giving back to the community where the botanical oils are sourced.  Each African oil has its own heritage story, having been used for centuries by local communities to nourish, moisturise and protect their skin. Daughter of the Soil skincare range celebrates the heritage of these natural oils, completing their story. We believe this truly defines our proposition.
We believe that the key to our success is ensuring an uncompromising commitment to the quality of our product, strong brand ethical and moral commitment, investment into the source of the produce materials, and the ability to develop and distribute our product to meet short lead times and high demand needs.
The Social MissionThe social mission, 'Connect the DOTS'  is to put back into the continent that yields such powerful ingredients for the range. The founders of the Company pledge a percentage of profits and equity to social programme Connect the DOTS which will deliver a certified functional training programme for marginalised women in Africa.Designed to empower women in agriculture by giving them the ability to earn an income. The goal is to have 10 million DOTS certified women working in Africa by 2025.Our CampaignThe below range of product bundles gives you the chance to try the range ahead of its UK launch, as well as helping the team in its aim to Empower Women in Africa.EARLY BIRD
